alert.note: Alert for Dallam; Deaf Smith; Hartley; Moore; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 01 at 3:20PM CDT until April 02 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 10 PM CDT SUNDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 10 PM CDT Sunday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity is in effect from Monday morning through Monday evening. In addition, a Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity has been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Texas...Dallam...Hartley...Moore...Oldham... Potter...Deaf Smith...Randall and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...Sunday, southwest at 15-20 mph. Monday, southwest at 20-35 mph, and Tuesday, westerly at 35-40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 5 percent Sunday and Monday and 8 percent Tuesday. * Red Flag Threat Index...4-5 on Sunday and 6-8 on Monday and Tuesday. * Timing...Sunday noon to 10 PM. Monday 10 AM to midnight. Tuesday 6 AM to midnight.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
